alert.note: Alert for Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 1:17AM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AGAIN TODAY AND TUESDAY... * Numerous showers and thunderstorms are expected today with only a slight decrease in coverage Tuesday. Storms will favor the afternoon and evening hours. * Storms will be capable of heavy rainfall, frequent lightning, hail up to nickel size, and erratic wind gusts in excess of 40 mph. Outflow winds could kick up areas of blowing dust and impact area highways including I-80 and Highway 50 east of Reno and Carson City. * If you have outdoor plans, be sure to have a way to seek shelter within a sturdy building in case a thunderstorm forms nearby. If you do not have access to a sturdy building, a hard-topped vehicle with the windows rolled up is a good protective option from lightning. If you are on a lake, winds may increase suddenly from storms far away. The preferred time for outdoor activities and travel will be in the morning prior to the development of thunderstorms.
